info.description:
API v3 targets v2 functionality with a few minor additions. The API is accessible via https://api.thetvdb.com and provides the following REST endpoints in JSON format.


How to use this API documentation
----------------


You may browse the API routes without authentication, but if you wish to send requests to the API and see response data, then you must authenticate.
1. Obtain a JWT token by `POST`ing  to the `/login` route in the `Authentication` section with your API key and credentials.
1. Paste the JWT token from the response into the "JWT Token" field at the top of the page and click the 'Add Token' button.


You will now be able to use the remaining routes to send requests to the API and get a response.


Language Selection
----------------


Language selection is done via the `Accept-Language` header. At the moment, you may only pass one language abbreviation in the header at a time. Valid language abbreviations can be found at the `/languages` route..


Authentication
----------------


Authentication to use the API is similar to the How-to section above. Users must `POST` to the `/login` route with their API key and credentials in the following format in order to obtain a JWT token.

`{"apikey":"APIKEY","username":"USERNAME","userkey":"USERKEY"}`

Note that the username and key are ONLY required for the `/user` routes. The user's key is labled `Account Identifier` in the account section of the main site.
The token is then used in all subsequent requests by providing it in the `Authorization` header. The header will look like: `Authorization: Bearer <yourJWTtoken>`. Currently, the token expires after 24 hours. You can `GET` the `/refresh_token` route to extend that expiration date.


Versioning
----------------


You may request a different version of the API by including an `Accept` header in your request with the following format: `Accept:application/vnd.thetvdb.v$VERSION`. This documentation automatically uses the version seen at the top and bottom of the page.
info.title: TheTVDB API v3

Accept-Language.description: Records are returned with the some fields in the desired language, if it exists. If there is no translation for the given language, then the record is still returned but with empty values for the translated fields.
Accept-Language.name: Accept-Language

filterKeys.description: Comma-separated list of keys to filter by
filterKeys.name: keys

fromTime.description: Epoch time to start your date range.
fromTime.name: fromTime

itemId.description: ID of the ratings record that you wish to modify
itemId.name: itemId

itemType.description: Item to update. Can be either 'series', 'episode', or 'image'
itemType.name: itemType

itemTypeNR.description: Item to query. Can be either 'series', 'episode', or 'banner'
itemTypeNR.name: itemType

keyType.description: Type of image you're querying for (fanart, poster, etc. See ../images/query/params for more details).
keyType.name: keyType

page.description: Page of results to fetch. Defaults to page 1 if not provided.
page.name: page

resolution.description: Resolution to filter by (1280x1024, for example)
resolution.name: resolution

seriesSearchName.description: Name of the series to search for.
seriesSearchName.name: name

since.description: Epoch time to start your date range.
since.name: since

slug.description: Slug from site URL of series (https://www.thetvdb.com/series/$SLUG)
slug.name: slug

subKey.description: Subkey for the above query keys. See /series/{id}/images/query/params for more information
subKey.name: subKey

toTime.description: Epoch time to end your date range. Must be one week from `fromTime`.
toTime.name: toTime

zap2itId.description: Zap2it ID of the series to search for.
zap2itId.name: zap2itId

tags.description: Obtaining and refreshing your JWT token
tags.name: Authentication

tags.description: Series that have been recently updated.
tags.name: Updates

get.description: Returns the full information for a given episode id. __Deprecation Warning:__ The _director_ key will be deprecated in favor of the new _directors_ key in a future release.

200.description: An array of query keys as strings

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given episode ID does not exist.

get.description: All available languages. These language abbreviations can be used in the `Accept-Language` header for routes that return translation records.

200.description: An array of language objects.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

get.description: Information about a particular language, given the language ID.

200.description: An array of language objects.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given language ID does not exist.

post.description: Returns a session token to be included in the rest of the requests. Note that API key authentication is required for all subsequent requests and user auth is required for routes in the `User` section

parameters.description: JSON string containing your authentication details.
parameters.name: Authentication string

200.description: Returns a JWT token for use with the rest of the API routes

401.description: Invalid credentials and/or API token

get.description: Returns a movies records that contains all information known about a particular movies id.

200.description: A movie record.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist

get.description: Returns all movies ids updated since a given timestamp.

200.description: All movies ids updated since a given date

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

get.description: Refreshes your current, valid JWT token and returns a new token. Hit this route so that you do not have to post to `/login` with your API key and credentials once you have already been authenticated.

200.description: Returns a new token to use in your subsequent requests

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

get.description: Allows the user to search for a series based on the following parameters.

200.description: An array of results that match the provided query.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if no records are found that match your query.

get.description: Returns an array of parameters to query by in the `/search/series` route.

200.description: An array of query keys as strings

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

get.description: Returns a series records that contains all information known about a particular series id.

200.description: A series record.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist

head.description: Returns header information only about the given series ID.

200.description: Series header information. Good for getting the Last-Updated header to find out when the series was last modified.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist

get.description: Returns actors for the given series id

200.description: An array of actor objects for the given series id.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist

get.description: All episodes for a given series. Paginated with 100 results per page.

200.description: An array of episode objects for the given series id.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist

get.description: This route allows the user to query against episodes for the given series. The response is a paginated array of episode records.

200.description: An array of basic Episode results that matched the query

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist or the query returns no results.

get.description: Returns the allowed query keys for the `/series/{id}/episodes/query` route

200.description: An array of query keys as strings

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist or the query returns no results.

get.description:
Returns a summary of the episodes and seasons available for the series.

__Note__: Season "0" is for all episodes that are considered to be specials.

200.description: A summary of the episodes and seasons avaialable for the given series.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist

get.description: Returns a series records, filtered by the supplied comma-separated list of keys. Query keys can be found at the `/series/{id}/filter/params` route.

200.description: A filtered series record

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist

get.description: Returns the list of keys available for the `/series/{id}/filter` route

200.description: A list of keys to filter by

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist

get.description: Returns a summary of the images for a particular series

200.description: A summary of the image types and counts available for the given series.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist

get.description: Query images for the given series ID.

200.description: An array of basic Episode results that matched the query

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist or the query returns no results.

get.description: Returns the allowed query keys for the `/series/{id}/images/query` route. Contains a parameter record for each unique `keyType`, listing values that will return results.

200.description: An array of query keys as strings

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if the given series ID does not exist or the query returns no results.

get.description:
Returns an array of series that have changed in a maximum of one week blocks since the provided `fromTime`.


The user may specify a `toTime` to grab results for less than a week. Any timespan larger than a week will be reduced down to one week automatically.

200.description: An array of Update objects that match the given timeframe.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if no records exist for the given timespan

get.description: Returns an array of valid query keys for the `/updated/query/params` route.

200.description: An array of Update objects that match the given timeframe.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if no records exist for the given timespan

get.description: Returns basic information about the currently authenticated user.

200.description: User information.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if no information exists for the current user

get.description: Returns an array of favorite series for a given user, will be a blank array if no favorites exist.

200.description: User favorites.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if no information exists for the current user

delete.description: Deletes the given series ID from the user’s favorite’s list and returns the updated list.

200.description: List of user favorites.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if no information exists for the current user

409.description: Returned if requested record could not be deleted

put.description: Adds the supplied series ID to the user’s favorite’s list and returns the updated list.

200.description: List of user favorites.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if no information exists for the current user

409.description: Returned if requested record could not be updated

get.description: Returns an array of ratings for the given user.

200.description: Array of user ratings.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if no information exists for the current user

get.description: Returns an array of ratings for a given user that match the query.

200.description: List of user ratings that match the given query.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if no information exists for the current user

get.description: Returns a list of query params for use in the `/user/ratings/query` route.

200.description: Parameters to use for querying.

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if no information exists for the current user

delete.description: This route deletes a given rating of a given type.

200.description: Returns OK if the delete was successful

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if no rating is found that matches your given parameters

put.description: This route updates a given rating of a given type.

200.description: Update OK if the update was successful

401.description: Returned if your JWT token is missing or expired

404.description: Returned if no rating is found that matches your given parameters

invalidQueryParams.description: Invalid query params passed to route

airedEpisodes.description: Number of all aired episodes for this series

dvdEpisodes.description: Number of all dvd episodes for this series

average.description: Average rating for the given record.

count.description: Number of ratings for the given record.
